      • Ab T2 weeks ago
        Took the tram around the gardens. $10 for adults, $5 for children. Really worth it for the guided tour and an overview of the place. After that we took a walk around and had a nice cuppa in the cafe.
      • Merve O'KeefeFebruary 8
        Huge, beautiful garden with over 40 thousand types of plants and trees. I recommend using the little train inside the park as it is very very big plus the train driver doubles as a guide of the park.
      • LiliÃ¡na BaloghðŸŒºDecember 25, 2015
        Nicest garden I have ever been, super cool that it is in the middle of the city center, you forget you are in Sydney! You need days here, it's huge so many things to explore!
      • Crumbs Cake ArtJuly 15, 2013
        FREE entry & a MUST to see when visiting Sydney. Explore the beautiful grounds of flowers and fauna. Amazing restaurant setting in the gardens. Also a really great place for getting married.
      • Lady HobolinaJanuary 25
        Go from circular quay and follow the docks to the opera house, move from there to the gardens, after go visit the art museum at the end. Take the bus back to wherever from the museum.
      • Johanan OttensooserApril 26, 2014
        Been here 5+ times
        There are beautiful little secret gardens to find, with roses or veggies or fragrant flowers, try to find your own secret spot!

      • Czar TJanuary 12, 2012
        Been here 5+ times
        Avoid lunch hour. That's when the Gardens staff do most of their driving, mowing, sawing, clipping, and generally disturbing as many people as possible. Try earlier or later and it will be tranquil.

      Royal Botanic Garden
      Macquarie St (Cahill Express Way)
      Sydney NSW 2000
      Australia
      Get directions
      The Royal Botanic Garden, Sydney, is a place of natural beauty, where people come for peace, relaxation, education, and to learn more about plants and horticulture. The surrounding parkland of the Domain is a place for sport, entertainment and recreation.
      Open until 5:30 PM (Show more)
      • Monâ€“Sun
        • 9:00 AMâ€“5:30 PM
      +61 2 9231 8111
      rbgsyd.nsw.gov.au
      @rbgsydney
